channel.title: Can't connect to my own server?
channel.description:
Hey, I have never really had this problem before, and I've been hosting for a couple years.
I am hosting on a new computer. I have done everything, and other people are able to connect fine.
My only problem is that I can't connect from the computer I'm hosting on.
Is it a problem with the No-Ip?
Any help is appreciated. Thanks.

item.title: Can't connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

If you hosting off your computer, make your client connect to the localhost

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to my own server?

item.title: Can't connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

First, You can connect to your local network by three Ip’s 1: 127.0.0.1 2: 0.0.0.0 4: your own Ip.
Second, 192.168.0.1 Is the adress to your router -.-’.
Third, if you wan’t other players to play your server you will have to portforward

No-ip is just a alias name for your Ip.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to my own server?

item.title: Can't connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

Damnit. I forgot to change my IP in the client to my Routers IP address, rather than my no-ip address.

It’s not localhost, it’s the 192.168.0.1 address I’m supposed to connect with.

I can’t believe I was this dumb.

Thanks for the help anyways guys.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to my own server?

item.title: Can't connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @Vengpwe Vengpwe
item.description:
@Vengpwe wrote:

Dude, 127.0.0.1 is the only IP you can connect to your public server with, only players can connect to your no-ip.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to my own server?

item.title: Can't connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

I don’t want to connect to my local host… I want to connect to my public server.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to my own server?

item.title: Can't connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @Arcane_Mage Arcane Mage
item.description:
@Arcane_Mage wrote:

go into your client download, search for “client”

Find it, click on it

Click Control+F

type in “no-ip”

if you cant find anything type in “127.0.0.1”

Once you have found it, change it to “127.0.0.1”

Find all of the things that say “no-ip”, and change them all to “127.0.0.1”

Compile it, then you should be able to log in

Read full topic
item.source: Can't connect to my own server?
